text: The active metabolite of vitamin D , 1 , 25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 [ 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 ] , is a potent regulator of human monocyte / macrophage function in vitro .

To establish a model for 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 regulation of human monocyte monokine synthesis , three human cell lines ( U-937 , THP-1 , and HL-60 ) were examined for : 1 ) the presence of functional 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 receptors ; 2 ) the accumulation of <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) mRNA and <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in response to lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) ; and 3 ) the regulation of this response by 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 .

text: All three cell lines expressed <extra_id_0> vitamin D receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and had increased levels of <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in response to LPS .

text: Preincubation of cells with 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 augmented <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels only in U-937 and HL-60 cells .
From these data , and taking into consideration their state of differentiation and relative ease of culture , U-937 was chosen over HL-60 and THP-1 as the cell line we further characterized .
In U-937 cells , optimum time and dose of pretreatment with 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 were determined to be 12-24 h at a receptor saturating concentration of 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 ( 10 nM ) .
Preincubation of cells with 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 had no effect on the time course of <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA appearance in response to LPS .

text: However , exposure of U-937 cells to 1 , 25 - ( OH ) 2D3 increased by 200 % the level of <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA detected and decreased by three orders of magnitude the concentration of LPS required to achieve steady state mRNA levels equivalent to those observed in U-937 cells not preincubated with the hormone.2+o
